b: ^A group is listening to a news projection.
^The lab is busy, seems like there's plenty of work coming in.
^The room is filled with booths of scientists showing off their work, must be a fair.
^Not much seems to be happening in the lab.
^Room is empty but lots of noise coming from the library.
^Much of the equipment and furniture is gone.
^Lab is gone, the planet will be destroyed soon.
^A handful of scientists huddle around a projected figure I don't recognize, but they seem to be listening somberly.
^The lab is filled with a buzzling excitement and energy as scientists, assistants, and cityfolk move about from task to task.
^The room is lined with booths, boards, and flashy experiments. Judges walk around with their hands behind their backs as eager young scientists stand at attention.
^The lab is quiet. A desk clerk taps their pen against a clipboard at random.
^A large crowd of various employees of the lab crowd around a projection of the Director, even the wasteman strains to listen.
^The lab is empty, but I hear the roar of a crowd coming from the library.
^The lab is litered with balloon arches and confetti liters the ground. 'DIRECTOR'S NAME continues reign' is sprawled everywhere on posers and decorations.
^Lab employees simply step over the confetti and continue their work.
^The lab is incredibly bare. I see very few lab stations remaining and everything that wasn't attached to the floor or the wall is gone, replaced only by a clean spot in the layer of dust.
^A layer of dust covers everything in the lab, but there was hardly anything for it to cover besides the floor and walls. I feel a quiet and deep rumbling far below me.

^What was once a lab has now been completely swallowed up by a monsterous hole. Fire has consumed most of the other sections of the building, but the hole seems to shoot straight down to the center of the planet.
^Many scientists are present, but they look too busy to talk to me.
^I see the Director in his office.
^Many scientists are present, but they look too busy to talk to me.
^I see the Director in his office.
^There are dozens of scientists and judges, but they're too busy proving their worth to speak to me.
^I see the Director in his office.
^Jules stands in front of a booth of his own.
^There aren't too many people in the lab today, but Jules sits at his work station eating lunch it seems.
^I see the Director in his office.
^Everyone is fixated on the projection of the Director, but I see Jules sitting by himself nearby.
^There is no one in the lab, they seem to be elsewhere.
^No one here seems willing to talk to me.
^I don't see anyone to talk to.
^I don't see anyone to talk to and there hasn't been anyone here for awhile.
^Everyone who once worked in the lab is long gone.

c-1: ^ I don't need to talk to anyone right now.

meetJules: ^"Of all times, why are you back now?"
^"But it's good to see you again!"
^"I'm sorry, it is good to see you too..."
^"Where have you been? You were gone for so long, we were all worried something had happened."

c-0: ^"Out and about? Why so coy Alistair?"
^"I don't know what you could be talking about..."
^"You are too easy to read my friend."
c-1: ^"Out and about? Why so coy Alistair?"
^"I don't know what you could be talking about..."
^"You are too easy to read my friend."

meetDirector: ^"Greetings, I am Bennet Crabb, the Director of the labratory."
^"I'm Alistair! I interned here with Jules Ambrose?"
^"I would have prefered to have forgotten that name, but it seems you have returned."
^"But your poor disipinary marks have certainly not been forgotten."

c-0: ^"I'm not sure what you could be referencing, sir!"
^"Do not play coy with me, boy."
c-1: ^"Sir, I am quite sorry, please accept my apology."
g-0: ^"You abandoned your duties, your job, here at the lab with nary a hint of warning."
^"That sort of behavior is most unprofessional."
^"Do not think that your return to the planet will secure you a position once again."
^"I have much work to attend to."

c-1: ^"Yes, yes, be gone. I am quite busy."

VaultTalk: ^"I believe I misplaced some of my belongings before I left."
^"Out with it, what do you want?"
^"I left behind some of my belongings in the vault, but-"
^"I really need them! You wouldn't mind just letting me into the vault for a moment would you?"
^"You are no longer employed here and you should know that civilians are strictly prohibited access to any classified materials in the vault."

c-0: ^"Sir, I really need my belongings that I left in the vault."
c-1: ^"I know that this is a breach of protocol, but perhaps you could make an exception for an ex-intern?"
g-0: ^"What even is it that you want from the vault?"

c-2: ^"My research notes. They're still inside the vault."
^"Those notes belong to the lab now."
^"When you left your position, those materials became part of the collective research of the lab."

g-1: ^"No, access to the vault is prohibited."
^"It matters not what it is you want from it."

c-4: ^"I must get into the vault, sir!"
c-5: ^"Please, sir, I need to get into the vault..."

g-2: ^"Silence, I have already made my decision."
^"Be gone now, I am incredibly occupied at the moment."
^(Speaking to Bennet is like talking to a wall...)
^"It is improbable that Mr. Bennet Crabb is the only one who can get into the vault."
^"Perhaps we can seek out another employee."
^"They might be able to help us or to give us some new information."
^"Jules still works for the lab. We interned together."
^"Perhaps he can help since we can't get through to Bennet."

TempEnd: ^This is the end of our demo, thank you so much for playing!
^Be sure to follow our 'Chronautical' socials and let us know what you think!
